select no, city_name from city
select p.no, p.port_name from port p, city c where p.city_no = c.no and c.no = #{no}

select p.no, p.port_name from port p, timetable t where (p.no = t.port_no1 or p.no = t.port_no2) and (t.port_no2 = #{port_no} or t.port_no1 = #{port_no}) and p.no != #{port_no} group by p.no, p.port_name
select * from port

select s.no, s.ship_name, se.no seatno, se.seat_total, se.seat_person, se.seat_student, se.seat_child, se.seat_grand, se.seat_baby, se.seat_grade, t.no timeno, t.timetable_dtime, t.timetable_ltime from ship s, seatinfo se, timetable t where t.port_no1 = #{port_no1} and t.port_no2 = #{port_no2} and t.timetable_date = to_date(#{timetable_date}) and s.no = t.ship_no and s.no = se.ship_no group by s.no, s.ship_name, se.no, se.seat_total, se.seat_person, se.seat_student, se.seat_child, se.seat_grand, se.seat_baby, se.seat_grade, t.no, t.timetable_dtime, t.timetable_ltime
select * from seatinfo where no = #{no}

select r.resvterms_content from terms t, resvterms r where t.ship_no = #{ship_no} and t.resvterms_num = r.resvterms_num
select resvterms_num from terms where ship_no = #{ship_no}
select resvterms_content from resvterms where resvterms_num = 114
